result.execSummary:
The defendant Sckuyler A Elim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, credit for 287 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms, body armor, or weapons.

No contact with drug community.
No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Defendant to be monitored by the Mental Health Unit. Take all prescribed medications.

Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment, and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.
No positive results.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NGI plea withdrawn.  On motion of the State, court ordered the "Use of a Dangerous Weapon" penalty enhancer stricken from the charge.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 42 months, consecutive any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 287 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 36 months with the following conditions:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment, and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Defendant to be monitored by the Mental Health Unit.  Take all prescribed medications.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms, body armor, or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Sckuyler A Elim not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense intends to withdraw its NGI plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard J. Carpenter in court, defendant Sckuyler A Elim not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Order for doctor's report never sent to the doctor.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 26.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin for James Griffin.
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 26.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court reinstates $10,000 cash bail.  Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
Court ordered Dr. Robert Rawski be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 26.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 12-08-2014 at 08:30 am.
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed.  alp
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties review the doctor's report.  State and Defense do not challenge the report.  The Court found defendant DOES LACK THE COMPACITY TO UNDERSTAND COURT PROCEEDINGS.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
dated 7/29/14 from Dr. Rawski.  kmw

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Court orders defendant REMANDED and proceedings suspended.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 34.  Court order 7/14 trial vacated.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
dated 7/5/14 from Dr Rawski.  kmw

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Sckuyler A Elim not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter scheduled for Return on Doctor's Report.  Dr. Rawski is requesting additional time to complete the report. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 34.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, filed. cmt
from Dr. Rawski,  filed.
Order for Examination.

Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received on 5/5/14.  Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of the client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as to the special plea. Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmit-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Calvin P.; Pearline E. or 1807 S 16th Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Sckuyler A Elim in custody.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
